description: Single storey, part two storey side side/rear (wrap around) extension incorporating a Juliet balcony to first floor rear elevation (following demolition of existing side and rear additions); conversion of a garage into a habitable room including associated external alteration involving the insertion of a window in lieu of the garage door opening; excavation to provide basement level for habitable space, including two lightwells and screening plants to front and lower level terrace to rear of property; rear roof extension and installation of two roof lights and windows to front roof slopes (following demolition of two chimney stacks); alteration to external elevations (revised description)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: SO-935-01, SO-935-02, Existing Elevations (unnumbered), SO-935-10 REV.D, SO-935-11 REV.D, SO-935-12 REV.D, SO-935-13 REV.D, SO-935-14 REV.C, SO-935-15 REV.D, SO-935-16 REV.C
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The basement shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the house, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, or any commercial use. Access shall only be provided through the house, as detailed in the approved drawing reference SO-935-10 REV.D.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
